```{r}
# set up
library(readr)
library(lubridate)
library(tidyverse)
library(janitor)


bls_data <- read_csv("C:/Users/cp3789/Documents/GitHub/quant_capstone/data_clean/BLS_county_employment_clean.csv") %>% 
  clean_names("snake") #convert column names to snake case

#need to make numeric versions of the date variables - not done yet
bls_data %>% 
  mutate(across(c(state_start, state_end, federal_start, federal_end), as.numeric)) %>% 
  mutate(first_treat = case_when(
    treatment == 1 ~ federal_end,
    treatment == 0 ~ state_end,
    state == "MA" ~ 0)) #never-treated group

bls_data %>% 
  group_by(state, countyname, fips) %>% tally()

bls_data %>% 
  select(date, fips, unemployment_rate, )
```
